website_summaries.verdict: Will open the minds of those looking to diversify their investment portfolios with high-level information and common sense strategies.
pros: Investment strategies for the sophisticated investor or students who are prepared for a book packed with information
While there are a breadth of investment concepts, each are written with an action plan that readers can implement in real life
cons: Does require some prior knowledge of markets and investment strategy to gain the most from this book

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Introduction into Index Investing
customer_reviews.text: When I first picked this book up, I thought it'd be like the other gimmicky investment books you see everywhere...but was I wrong! This book is an excellent introduction into index investing by taking you through the history of stock markets, schools of thought, failed strategies, historical proof of index investing, and applications. I highly recommend this book to the beginner and time-tested investor alike.
customer_reviews.author: Dakotah Hogan

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if this book will help me make ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this book will help me make money in the stock market but it has given me confidence to invest regularly. Malkiel repeats his mantra of investing in low-cost, broad-based indexes repeatedly and convincingly but also clearly explains many other investing options with their advantages and disadvantages. This is also not the dry textbook I expected. The humor and levity in the writing, in addition to the rich information, made reading this book pleasurable.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: ' this is the only other book I think I really got good, sound
customer_reviews.text: This is THE book of books for any regular guy wanting to learn about most, if not all, types of investing. Save yourself time and money and just get this book. You will have no need to read another investing book...ever. With the exception of 'The Millionaire Next Door,' this is the only other book I think I really got good, sound, and useful advise from. It's a ten star book (twice as good as the best investments books I've read)
customer_reviews.author: Rankle1

customer_reviews.title: A good analysis of the financial world.
customer_reviews.text: The author explicates with great passion and efficientness the most important charactersistics of this model. We are in the context of the Hypothesis of Efficient Market (HEM), By a mathematical view we consider the importance of the random walk. Surely there is psychological factors next those behaviors. In last analysis a book well written with attention to all that works in economics.
customer_reviews.author: Edoardo Angeloni

customer_reviews.title: Best financial book you can get
customer_reviews.text: This book has been a real eye opener, and it is now my favorite book on the topic of investing. All the typical basic topics for novice investors to those seeking to expand their knowledge are covered. Also covered is the rationale behind the data and stories, common pitfalls and traps, and the "teach a man to fish" approach. If I had one issue with the book, it would be that portfolio construction could use more coverage but I suppose that could be several volumes of its own.
customer_reviews.author: ---K---

customer_reviews.title: No better book for new investors
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these to give to my young adult children one Christmas. Got some very funny looks. Now that they have read the books, they are excited about smart investing for their future and we have another common area of discussion. A shame that personal finance is not a required course taught at schools or universities.
customer_reviews.author: melissa snyder

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive look at investment strategies
customer_reviews.text: While I'll admit that the author recommends an investment strategy that I already believe in and practice, he also introduces a variety of other strategies, some of which I didn't know of previously or understand completely. While probably not the first book a novice investor should read, it certainly should be in the rotation after an adequate foundation of basic investment theory is established.
customer_reviews.author: Haolezeus

customer_reviews.title: A good start
customer_reviews.text: Great read or listen. Provides a lot of good information on how to invest and what you might expect in return. Audiobook does not cover derivatives and options calls. So you need to read the last 20% of material yourself.
customer_reviews.author: FilipM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and practical baseline book for investing
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read this years ago. Burton Malkiel provides the reader with a firm foundation of investing fundamentals backed up with a lot of data and historical context. He arms the reader with knowledge of terminology and some key philosophical approaches to investing. Most importantly, the reader will develop a healthy skepticism about various investment products and approaches that are often touted by the industry today. As near as I have come to a "life changing" read.
customer_reviews.author: RBH

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this book
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this book. I am a recent college grad who never took a business/finance class and I found this book to be very helpful. Once I get my highest interest student loans paid off in the next year or two I will definitely be following a lot of the advice in this book when I set up my retirement and investment accounts. I will admit the middle of this book kind of drags a bit but the beginning and the end are packed with lots of informative material.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Financial Market Overview and Detail Descriptions
customer_reviews.text: I think, a complete and detailed overview of Wall Street. Ideal for those beginning investors, and for those who want a thorough overview of the Financial Markets. It could also be used as a Reference Book going to specific product descriptions each with their pros and cons. I treasure this book.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Henry, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, No new information
customer_reviews.text: He clearly has a bias. It runs on with alot of studies with not alot of depth. The whole intro is basically: Diversify and you should create your own indexes. This book is not really geared towards experienced investors but instead to the typical bystander.
customer_reviews.author: peter rigali

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for get-rich-quick investment advice, this ain't it.
customer_reviews.text: By the man who suggested the concept of index mutual funds before they existed. A favorite book of Jack Bogle, founder of Vanguard funds and generally considered the father of index funds. As an engineer, I love the fact that Mr. Malkiel backs up his investment advice with plenty of data and clear analysis of all the major competing approaches to investing. Takes some concentration and effort to get through all of the analysis, but it's pretty easy to get to the bottom line - NOBODY beats the market averages for the long haul, but you don't have to to build significant wealth.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best book on investing I have ever read
customer_reviews.text: The best book on investing I have ever read. If you are at all interested in finance or investing you will not be able to put this book down. Malkiel is an investing genius who debunks so many theories. Really pinpoints how to create a solid portfolio. Many advanced aspects are also covered in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Adamwalsh21

customer_reviews.title: Great for Finance Folks, New and Old
customer_reviews.text: One of my new favorite books for investing. Essentially Makliel runs you through every major speculative bubble in history [even back through the 1500's!], and tries to make that point that making money in investing isn't the hard part, yet keeping your money from being swept up in market mania is. Great for a seasoned student in finance or someone looking to get an introduction into investing.
customer_reviews.author: VTHokies

customer_reviews.title: He gives a great example of how flipping a coin will give a ...
customer_reviews.text: If you trade stocks, you must read this. Swing or Day trader. He gives a great example of how flipping a coin will give a random chart that looks like something, but it was just random and independent. Dispels a lot of myths out there. This $15 book could save or make you 1000s.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Reality check
customer_reviews.text: Well written, easy read. Straight forward, not fancy info. Some surprising revelations if you though you could beat the market. Don’t kid yourself and leave the losing, I mean gambling to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Lew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent investment book
customer_reviews.text: The author writes about investing in a way that is easily understood and he does it with a sense of humor as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Frasier

customer_reviews.title: A good read for young investors. The more experienced readers will like the end chapters.
customer_reviews.text: Interesting information for those trying to invest. Only issue is the statement to consistently make good investment returns for the long haul is to buy index funds. Works if you have many years to grow funds. Most folks start later in life and need something to help fight inflation. At end of his book the author gives good information.
customer_reviews.author: J2018G

customer_reviews.title: Always have Book in your Investment Library!
customer_reviews.text: I read so often, I sometimes think that once in a while I should read something that might materially benefit me. ONe of the top 5 Investing Bibles in everyone collection!
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: An excellent read for anyone interested in investing
customer_reviews.text: This was an extremely well written book that defines important financial nomenclature (e.g., efficient market hypothesis, modern portfolio theory, arbitrage, etc, etc) in a very easy to understand way. I applaud the author for devoting so many years to so many editions of this fine book. In sum, Burton Malkiel emphasizes that passive, indexed investments will be actively managed portfolios in the majority of cases. A classic whose recommendations for investment have stood the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: All Time Favorite Financial Book
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite financial book updated with lots of recent knowledge. Read it and make sure your financial adviser has read it. Following its advice has probably saved me vast amounts of money in fees and bad investment decisions.
customer_reviews.author: AJGB

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit this book is pretty dense, but I LOVE IT. I've learned more from this one book than I have from several others in its category. The best part is the advice still applies today!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny L

customer_reviews.title: This is Fundamental reading for all equity investors. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is Fundamental reading for all equity investors. I first read this book about 25 years ago, it served me well. Just bought the new edition as a refresher and for all the new material it added. The book is not only academically sound, intellectually rigorous, but also gives practical, actionable advices, a rare combination. Especially valuable for young investors who can benefit from buy and hold strategies.
customer_reviews.author: leon zhao

customer_reviews.title: Learning my options
customer_reviews.text: This was something I wanted to read or see a technique used for my studies. I liked what a read or viewed.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime S

customer_reviews.title: This book has been awesome in helping ease my mind into the world of ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a 29 year old father returning to college, working towards a major in Finance. This book has been awesome in helping ease my mind into the world of finance. A friend of mine, who works as a Senior Consultant, told me that this book is great for anyone looking for a better understanding of how finance/stocks/investments work. I couldn't agree more, highly recommend this book to anyone working in the field or anyone who would like to learn more about finance and how investments of all sorts work. Amazing book.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: A must read for all levels of investors
customer_reviews.text: Whether you have tens of thousands to invest or just $20 a month, this is an invaluable guide to navigate the choices ahead of you. My late father introduced me to the book in the early 90's and I read it again now 15 years later. Its one of the few books I'll read through multiple editions knowing that there is a great financial return on investment every time I read it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp

customer_reviews.title: A classic--must read for the causal investor
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful book--it has just gotten TOOOOOOOOO long. He could easily cut the size without hurting the content. Still, a MUST read for any investor.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: interesting and educational
customer_reviews.text: this takes you from the orgins of the stock market to present day. very interesting look at how the market responds to government intervention and irrational exhurberhance of the human spirit
customer_reviews.author: Brosnan

customer_reviews.title: This book was perfect - easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I am in the process of retiring and setting up my investments to meet my family's needs for the next few years on a lower income. This book was perfect - easy to read, sensible, and fits my amateur experience in the stock market over the last 30+ years. I wish I would have read this book many, many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: JCleveland

customer_reviews.title: you'll do fine as long as you learn
customer_reviews.text: A very encouraging book for the unsure investor. Common sense is all you need to do reasonably well. Do your homework and, with practice, you'll do fine as long as you learn, with practice, to recognize the charlatans
customer_reviews.author: valeria scioscioli

customer_reviews.title: "Res tantrum valet quantum vending potest" ~BGM
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a get rich quick scheme, don't buy this book. If you're in this for the long run, perfect strategies, and challenges multiple theories and research done by other experts in the field of the Financial Market. I read it often, and listen to the audio daily.
customer_reviews.author: JBoogi

customer_reviews.title: Best investment book ever written
customer_reviews.text: Sound investment advice. The first edition (1973) guided my investments for many years and I wanted to get an update with the 2015 edition. Best investment book ever written!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Best Investing Book I Have Read
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend reading both this and The Intelligent Investor by Benjamin Graham. These two books will tell you everything you need to know about investing on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: but also a lot of good advice for investors
customer_reviews.text: Must reading for anyone with interest in investing. A lot of insight on the market, i.e. the whys and the wherefores of market behavior, but also a lot of good advice for investors, even if one does not care about the reasons for market behavior. This book will not make one a multimillionaire, but it probably will lead to reasonable and steady returns on ones investments.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Z

customer_reviews.title: Gret book on Investing,
customer_reviews.text: If you are into investing and haven't read this already, please do. Very insightful and practical.
customer_reviews.author: Obaida Sakib

customer_reviews.title: A must read for investors
customer_reviews.text: Its a must read if you plan or already have money in stock market. It will make you understand past historical event and you will be able to spot new ones as they come.
customer_reviews.author: Pravin Pathak

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive Investment Walk Through
customer_reviews.text: Everything about investments was tackled in a very interesting & realistic way. Th book covers various type of investments, mostly applicable for the US financial markets, comparing, showing the pros & cons, guiding the reader to the best suitable plan. The most important point is the myth-busting cross the history of the markets.
customer_reviews.author: Saad H

customer_reviews.title: Good Book
customer_reviews.text: I have read read through yet; however, I felt it was just another stock market book. I did not remember what I have read.
customer_reviews.author: Nai

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic book - more about philosophy than fundamentals
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to force myself to learn about finance and investing, as someone who is *not* interested in those things at all. This book is so interesting though! The format of stories and historical anecdotes is great, I even found myself talking finance with 'the guys' on my last family vacation when telling them about this book. The only downside is that it does assume a basic knowledge of some of the foundation concepts in investing, so some concepts I either have to learn about elsewhere or just skim over without 100% 'getting' what the author is talking about.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: A blind folded monkey throwing darts at the stock listings could do better than a so called expert.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good book. It is one of the better investment books I have read. He is an evangelist for passive index investing based on the efficient markets theory. He has a chapter on smart beta. He does not believe in smart beta. He has changed his mind recently. Now he thinks that sophisticated algorithms that drive computer generated trading can beat the market.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good understandable review of investment theory
customer_reviews.text: Solid rational advice for the accumulation phases of retirement. The supplemental addition of explanations regarding derivatives, margins, futures may also appeal to more sophisticated investors (or those who wish to be).
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Book! Really taught me how to invest and ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Book! Really taught me how to invest and how not to invest. Really outlines many different aspects to investing and explains the different strategies behind Wall Street. This is a must read!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel E.

customer_reviews.title: Safely remove your portion from the Stock Market's safe
customer_reviews.text: A perfect book to guide any investor through the annals of the complicated world of investments, so that you wind up with long-term success by taking your share of market returns while protecting your downside. Burton Malkiel gives you the secret code to open the stock market's safe and safely remove your portion.
customer_reviews.author: timothy sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Informative stuff
customer_reviews.text: An amazing book giving an insight about various money market instruments. It also talks about the various factors that impact decision making for an individual investor. One should definitely read it before getting into investment. It can add to one’s information related to personal finance.

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Good simple book on stock investment, although it is a little basic. Efficient market hypothesis isn't nearly as sound as he wants it to be

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: - Easy to read - Concrete advice with examples, and explanations for people in differnet stages of their lives. The only thing I would have liked although not the target of the book, is how to handle investing in other countries. for example say a European country, how much do you put in local currency? in Euro? in USD?

customer_reviews.title: very good investing book for beginners
customer_reviews.text: good investing book with short stories of economic situations. Easy to comprehend

customer_reviews.title: Loved this book
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book. It was easy to read and very informative. It doesn't bog you down with too much technical info or excess math. It gives you just enough to get the points across and make you understand the underlying principles.

customer_reviews.title: Good book for medium knowledge investment people

customer_reviews.text: Don't agree with everything it says but it's a great read.

customer_reviews.title: Good read.
customer_reviews.text: It's a must read for those interested in the stock market. Very scholarly, and sometimes boring. The point of the author is people cannot beat the market. But in the clouding chapters gives advise on how to pick stocks.

customer_reviews.title: Latest edition of the best single guide available
customer_reviews.text: Still the clearest and best single book on the machinations of Wall Street, investing and individual strategies. I re-read from time-time (in recurring updated editions) and this last season made this a Christmas gift to my two sons-in-law and daughters.

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: One of the must read books. As the author says, 95% of information one reads or obtains is worth nothing. He does a great job making sure that the information contained in this book falls in the 5% category.

customer_reviews.title: The one book to acheive wealth in today's world.
customer_reviews.text: If you can read only one book about investing, this is the one to read! An excellent history of markets and how to succeed in today's market. Investing in a low cost broad based index fund along with systematic saving is the way to wealth today and for the future.
customer_reviews.author: F. Mange

customer_reviews.title: Important Financial Insight ...
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this book is one of the most important guides for the average person seeking an education on managing their financial well being. An excellent book for the person that is weary of needing to rely too much on so-called 'professionals' to look out for your best interest first and foremost. It is well written, revised over the years and is a pleasant read, especially for those of us who have a short attention span when it comes to financial talk. It will give the reader a better overall understanding of the financial process and therefore will help with the choices for wise investing by the novice.

I am still reading, but it's exactly what I was hoping for. "If You Think Education Is Expensive, Try Ignorance".

But If you just want a good working knowledge and don't really like investing or finance this is the book to read.

Material is updated through 2014 and the material in this most recent edition of the book first authored in 1973 is as relevant as ever.

customer_reviews.title: This is the most important book you will ever read in your life.
customer_reviews.text: Forget Morning Star, forget Barron's, forget WSJ, forget Bloomberg, forget the Goldman Sachs analyst report, forget scores of books on investment, or trading, forget your son-in-law suggestion to buy a hot stock, forget your father-in-law suggestion about dividend paying stock. Read this first and digest it well, then proceed slowly and thoughtfully while reminding yourself "You are only a mortal, your mind sees what is easier to see, you will make mistakes, try to make only very small mistakes".

customer_reviews.title: great finance and investing bible .
customer_reviews.text: This book is very comprehensive and covers all aspects of investing . It provides ton of great information on how the world of finance operates and how a retail investor can benefit by taking a long term view . The main gist revolves around buying low cost index fund and take the lifecycle approach to investing based on age and risk appetite . It also has good humor sprinkled around to make the text overall engaging . Also it is a big book and may take some time to finish. Overall if you are interested in world of investing and finance this is the best book out there .

customer_reviews.title: the cost of your human capital might be better spent learning a much more illiquid market
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely essential read for investors. In a day of capital gains taxes and high management fees, the odds of beating the market are close to insurmountable. Going over the basics of your investment turnover and the long term tax effect on your portfolio returns is critical to investing, and retiring, with enough in the bank! While patience and low book value, small stocks are likely to outperform, the cost of your human capital might be better spent learning a much more illiquid market. Malkiel makes the strongest argument yet for passive index investing. Before you allow that extra % point to go to your mutual fund manager, ask yourself, "Am I getting enough bang for my buck?"

customer_reviews.title: Makiel makes some great arguments against that thinking
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are still many people out there who think they can game the system, but Dr. Makiel makes some great arguments against that thinking. I'd already made my decision to take the route he recommends, and this just confirms my decision. Yes, you can get rich by picking a stock that takes off, but the odds are far better if you take the value approach and stick to the plan.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book for investors at any level.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book for investors at any level. Or anybody just interested in investing in general. It goes in great detail about every theory that has existed and exists, from both a practical and theoretical perspective. I found his writing to be clear and concise, and it's also clear that he has a great understanding about the subject. I won't go into much detail about the recommendations, to not spoil the book. But, if you're interested in learning about investing in the stock market. I would definitely give this book a try. It will give you a great understanding about the market.
customer_reviews.author: Elfrank

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Book.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book, as it was needed for a course for my Master's program; it wasn't a required book, but decided to purchase it anyway. I read the entire book cover-to-cover over the course of a weekend and it was a quick and easy read. The content wasn't dry, difficult to understand, or boring; it felt like a story (which is something I personally enjoyed) and was well written. I would recommend purchasing this book regardless of whether or not you need the book (for a course, for life, for fun). The book came packaged well and the the book in brand-new excellent quality! Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mikolaj S.
